-The neutron spectra from each of the sources used
-All the vanadium samples were metallic with natural
isotopic abundance. Disks of 10- and 13-mm diameter
Foils of aluminum, iron, nickel, indium, and niobium
with similar diameters were included along with
vanadium in multi-layer packets. Typical thicknesses
of auxiliary samples are less than 0.1 mm. The overall
thickness of each packet was less than 2 mm.
Auxiliary  samples served as primary or secondary
standards for neutron fluence determination and for
the purpose of determining corrections for low-energy
neutrons via the method of spectral indexing.
Cross sections were measured using the neutron
activation method. Packets containing the vanadium
samples and various additional monitor foils were
irradiated in well-defined geometries near the targets
Boron-trifluoride detector in a long counter
All measurements involving secondary standards were
ultimately referenced to the primary standard.
All relative measurements were ultimately normalized
used directly or indirectly for all the measurements
Spectral index component. This reaction is very
sensitive to the lowest-energy background neutrons.

x4freetext: experimental data following application of various
corrections. Final cross sections were deduced from

cross sections. When the measurements were made
relative to secondary standards or to relative neutron
fluence monitors, the data were normalized to the
primary standard by specific ratio measurements of the
secondary standards to the primary standard or by
calibration of the relative monitors to these
- Most of correction procedures were standard.
The neutron scattering corrections were derived by
the Monte-Carlo method, computer code MCNP.
Corrections were largest for the D-T neutron source
measurements at 4-MeV deuteron energy. Correction was
-The low-energy neutron corrections were deduced using
a representation of the neutron spectrum, evaluated
cross sections for the various spectral-index monitor
reactions, and estimates of the vanadium reaction
cross-section shape. The neutron spectrum determined
by time-of-flight measurement was transformed into
a few group representation which was then adjusted by
an application of the generalized least-squares
method that employed measured reaction rates for
-The raw experimental data were corrected for the
